metadata.name: Record
title: Gcloud
Dns
Record
metadata.description:
DNS Record

Represents a set of DNS resource records (RRs) for a given #name and #type in a Zone. Since it is a value object, a newly created Record instance is transient until it is added to a Zone with Zone#update. Note that Zone#add and the Zone#update block parameter can be used instead of Zone#record or Record.new to create new records.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"

zone.records.count #=> 2
record = zone.record "example.com.", "A", 86400, "1.2.3.4"
zone.records.count #=> 2
change = zone.update record
zone.records.count #=> 3

metadata.name: name
title: Gcloud
Dns
Record#name
metadata.description: The owner of the record. For example: example.com..

metadata.name: name=
title: Gcloud
Dns
Record#name=
metadata.description: The owner of the record. For example: example.com..

metadata.name: type
title: Gcloud
Dns
Record#type
metadata.description: The identifier of a supported record type . For example: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, or TXT.

metadata.name: type=
title: Gcloud
Dns
Record#type=
metadata.description: The identifier of a supported record type . For example: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, or TXT.

metadata.name: ttl
title: Gcloud
Dns
Record#ttl
metadata.description: The number of seconds that the record can be cached by resolvers.

metadata.name: ttl=
title: Gcloud
Dns
Record#ttl=
metadata.description: The number of seconds that the record can be cached by resolvers.

metadata.name: data
title: Gcloud
Dns
Record#data
metadata.description: The array of resource record data, as determined by type and defined in RFC 1035 (section 5) and RFC 1034 (section 3.6.1). For example: [“10 mail.example.com.”, “20 mail2.example.com.”].

metadata.name: data=
title: Gcloud
Dns
Record#data=
metadata.description: The array of resource record data, as determined by type and defined in RFC 1035 (section 5) and RFC 1034 (section 3.6.1). For example: [“10 mail.example.com.”, “20 mail2.example.com.”].

params.name: name
params.description: The owner of the record. For example: example.com..

params.name: type
params.description: The identifier of a supported record type. For example: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, or TXT.

params.name: ttl
params.description:
The number of seconds that the record can be cached
by resolvers.

params.name: data
params.description: The resource record data, as determined by type and defined in RFC 1035 (section 5) and RFC 1034 (section 3.6.1). For example: [“10 mail.example.com.”, “20 mail2.example.com.”].

metadata.name: dup
title: Gcloud
Dns
Record#dup
metadata.description: Returns a deep copy of the record. Useful for updating records, since the original, unmodified record must be passed for deletion when using Zone#update.
